Save
Our Date
- 9.29.17 -

*** WE ARE GETTING MARRIED ***

THE HAPPY COUPLE

In west of Boston, born of raised, on the soccer field is where they spent most their days...

Andrew and Jamie met in high school when they were 16 years old. Unable to drive together, as they both only had driving permits, the beginning of their relationship mostly consisted of driving behind each other and meeting at the movies. Dozens of Rib-B-Qs, school dances, and soccer games later, Andrew and Jamie graduated from Bromfield, with Jamie heading to Lafayette College and AJ on his way to the land of Huskies. They continued dating throughout college and law school, and now both work in Boston. In 2015, Andrew proposed on the Cliffs of Moher in Ireland, as Jamie’s family desperately tried to hide in the field behind them. Jamie and Andrew will be getting married after 11 years of dating (longer than most Hollywood marriages. RIP Brangelina), and would be so honored if you could join them! Sláinte!

*** THE GROOM ***

*** THE BRIDE ***

*** AT GIBBET HILL GROTON, MA ***

Counting
Down

THE WEDDING

The ceremony and the reception will take place at the Barn at Gibbet Hill in Groton, Massachusetts.

{{ partial "header.html" . }} {{ partial "nav.html" (dict "navClass" "top-bar fluid-width block-color nav-center sticky-nav") }}

AT GIBBET HILL BARN

GET DIRECTIONS
n

CEREMONY AND PARTY LOCATION

The Barn at Gibbet Hill
61 Lowell Rd, Groton, MA 01450

The ceremony and the reception will take place at the Barn at Gibbet Hill in Groton, Massachusetts. The barn is over 100 years old, and is located next to the Gibbet Hill Grill, which is one of the only restaurants in New England with a produce farm on site. The bulk of the produce for Gibbet Hill is grown at the farm and kept at its own root cellar and winter greenhouses.

PLACES OF INTEREST

Kimball Farm

400 Littleton Road (Rt. 110)
Westford, MA 01886

One of THE BEST ice cream places ever, plus Jamie used to work here! Our favorite flavors include Vanilla Swiss Almond and Moose Tracks. Not only do they have amazeballs ice cream, but they have a billion other activities, including mini golf and batting cages.

Nashoba Valley Winery

100 Wattaquadock Hill Rd
Bolton, MA 01740

This is a lovely little local winery overlooking the rolling hills of Bolton, Massachusetts.

Carlson Orchards

115 Oak Hill Rd
Harvard, MA 01451

Harvard doesn’t have much, but we DO have apples! Enjoy the fall in Harvard, MA by picking your own apples and eating some cider donuts at Carlson Orchards.

The General Store

1 Still River Rd
Harvard, MA 01451

Harvard in a nutshell: a quaint little store/cafe selling coffee, pastries, and other small-town cute goods.

The Bromfield School

14 Massachusetts Ave
Harvard, MA 01451

Where it all began <3
